main_failure_reasons: Research question no longer useful/feasible due to shifts in standards of care
failure_analysis.biological_insights: The high rate of failure due to sponsor decision and accrual issues suggests that small cell lung cancer is a challenging disease area with high unmet need. The termination of studies due to shifts in standards of care indicates that the treatment landscape is rapidly evolving, which may complicate the design and execution of clinical trials.
failure_analysis.successful_mechanism_hints: Given the diverse range of interventions tested, it is difficult to draw definitive conclusions about what might work based on these failures. However, the termination of some trials due to sponsor decisions not related to safety suggests that some of these interventions may still hold promise and could be worth revisiting in future studies.
key_challenges: Securing sufficient funding and sponsor support
Recruiting and retaining sufficient numbers of participants
Keeping pace with evolving standards of care

pdb_structures.title: Crystal structure of mouse PD-L1 nanobody
Crystal structure of a high affinity PD-L1 binder
Crystal structure of PD-L1 from P. dioica in complex with adenine
Crystal structure of the ribosome inactivating protein PDL1
MOPD-1 mutant-L47W

alternative_targets.rationale: PD-L1 is a key immune checkpoint that, when blocked, can enhance the body's immune response against cancer cells.

pdb_structures.title: Human PARP10 (ARTD10), catalytic fragment in complex with PARP inhibitor Veliparib
Cryo-EM structure of human tankyrase 2 SAM-PARP filament (G1032W mutant)
Crystal structure of the PARP domain of Arabidopsis RADICAL-INDUCED CELL DEATH1
Human ADP-RIBOSYLTRANSFERASE 7 (ARTD7/PARP15), CATALYTIC DOMAIN IN COMPLEX WITH STO1102
Solution structure of the first Zn-finger domain of poly(ADP-ribose) polymerase-1

alternative_targets.rationale: PARP inhibitors can induce synthetic lethality in cancer cells with BRCA1/2 mutations, which are common in small cell lung cancer.

pdb_structures.title: X-ray crystal structure of human anaplastic lymphoma kinase in complex with CH5424802
Pyruvate decarboxylase from Kluyveromyces lactis in complex with the substrate analogue methyl acetylphosphonate

Structure of the Human Anaplastic Lymphoma Kinase in Complex with PF- 06463922 ((10R)-7-amino-12-fluoro-2,10,16-trimethyl-15-oxo-10,15,16, 17-tetrahydro-2H-8,4-(metheno)pyrazolo(4,3-h)(2,5,11) benzoxadiazacyclotetradecine-3-carbonitrile).
Structure of the invertebrate ALK GRD
AUGbeta - FAM150A - ALKL1 60-128

alternative_targets.rationale: ALK rearrangements are a known driver of non-small cell lung cancer, and there is emerging evidence that they may also play a role in small cell lung cancer.

pdb_structures.title: Anti-EGFR nanobody EgB4
Crystal structure of the Fab fragment of the anti-EGFR antibody 7A7
Crystal structure of a murine antibody FAB 528
The Crystal Structure Of A Humanized Antibody Fv 528
Structure of the Major G-Quadruplex in the Human EGFR Oncogene Promoter Adopts a Unique Folding Topology with a Distinctive Snap-back Loop

alternative_targets.rationale: EGFR mutations are common in lung cancer, and EGFR inhibitors have shown efficacy in non-small cell lung cancer.

pdb_structures.title: Cryo-EM structure of photosynthetic LH1' complex of Roseospirillum parvum
Cryo-EM structure of the LH1 complex from Allochromatium tepidum
Cryo-EM structure of the LH1 complex from Allochromatium tepidum
Structure of the intact photosynthetic light-harvesting antenna-reaction center complex from a green sulfur bacterium
Crystal structure of the Fenna-Matthews-Olson Protein from Chlorobaculum Tepidum

alternative_targets.rationale: BCL-2 is overexpressed in many cases of small cell lung cancer, and BCL-2 inhibitors have shown promise in preclinical studies.

failed_trials_sample.title: A Study of Toca 511, a Retroviral Replicating Vector, Combined With Toca FC in Patients With Solid Tumors or Lymphoma (Toca 6)
conditions: IDH1 Mutated or MGMT Methylated Recurrent HGG (Not Recruiting)

interventions.name: Toca 511
interventions.description: Toca 511 consists of a purified retroviral replicating vector encoding a modified yeast cytosine deaminase (CD) gene. The CD gene converts the antifungal 5-fluorocytosine (5FC) to the anticancer drug 5-FU in cells that have been infected by the Toca 511 vector

interventions.name: Toca FC
interventions.description: Toca FC is an extended-release formulation of flucytosine. Toca FC is supplied as 500 mg white, oblong tablets with "TOCA FC" embossed on one side and "500" embossed on the other side

primary_outcomes.measure: Changes from baseline in immune activity in tumor and peripheral blood

failed_trials_sample.title: A Clinical Trial of TG6050 in Patients With Metastatic Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (Delivir)

interventions.name: TG6050
interventions.description: Oncolytic Vaccinia virus containing genes encoding the human interleukin 12 (IL-12) and an anti-CTLA4 antibody administered at different dose.

primary_outcomes.measure: Safety and tolerability (Adverse Event reported per NCI-CTCAE v5.0)
primary_outcomes.description: Incidence of Adverse Event reported per NCI-CTCAE v5.0, Dose limiting toxicity, Maximal tolerated dose, Maximum feasible dose and Serious Adverse Events.

failed_trials_sample.why_stopped: Sponsor decision not related to safety

failed_trials_sample.title: Topotecan and Cisplatin Versus Etoposide and Carboplatin in 1st Line Treatment of Patients With Small Cell Lung Cancer and Extensive Disease (SCLC-ED)

interventions.name: topotecan + cisplatin
interventions.description: topotecan IV 2 mg/sqm d1-3 + cisplatin IV 50 mg/sqm d3 q3W

interventions.name: Etoposide + carboplatin
interventions.description: Etoposide 120 mg/sqm IV d 1-3 + carboplatin AUC 5 d1 q3W

failed_trials_sample.title: Proton Beam Radiation With Concurrent Chemotherapy and Nelfinavir for Inoperable Stage III Non Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC)

interventions.name: Nelfinavir
interventions.description: Two dose levels of Nelfinavir will be evaluated in each concurrent chemotherapy group (carboplatin/paclitaxel and cisplatin/etoposide) at the RPTD does of proton beam radiotherapy: 625 and 1250 mg PO bid.

primary_outcomes.description: Ability to successfully plan proton plans
Dose limiting toxicities of grade 3 or higher per CTCAE 4.0
Late toxicities graded according to the RTOG/EORTC late morbidity scale

failed_trials_sample.title: A Study of BDTX-189, an Orally Available Allosteric ErbB Inhibitor, in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors.

interventions.name: BDTX-189
interventions.description: Participants received a daily, oral dose of BDTX-189 as part of a 3 week cycle.

primary_outcomes.measure: Number of Dose Limiting Toxicities as a Determinant of the Recommended Phase 2 Dose (RP2D)
primary_outcomes.description: Certain toxicities will be considered dose-limiting unless clearly attributable to an extraneous cause, such as underlying disease.
primary_outcomes.time_frame: After the first dose of treatment for up to 21 days.

failed_trials_sample.why_stopped: The development of BDTX-189 was discontinued by the sponsor.
